metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3189 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in bzip2recover in bzip2 1.0.6 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted bzip2 file,related to block ends set to before the start of the block.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bzip2 - 1.0.6-8.1
libbz2-1.0 - 1.0.6-8.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bzip2 package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.6-8.1').
